channel.title: Microsoft Excel questions
channel.description:
What would be the best way of extracting certain things from a document?
Like lets say all 48 letter words?

item.title: Microsoft Excel questions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If they are all in their own data record (row/column) you can use conditional formatting with the LEN() formula to highlight all the records that have a length of 32 or 48.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Excel questions
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Only one way I can think of, that’s using a text filter and using the ? character 48 times…cumbersome but it works.

What version of Excel are you using?

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Excel questions
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:2, topic:423784”]First off, excel does not work with ‘documents’, it works with spreadsheets. So do you mean Microsoft Word or do you mean a spreadsheet?

If you mean a spreadsheet, would all the data you need to sort through be in on column?[/quote]Maybe, what would be the best way to gather 32 or 48 lettered phrases using excel, or spreadsheet

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft Excel questions
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

First off, excel does not work with ‘documents’, it works with spreadsheets. So do you mean Microsoft Word or do you mean a spreadsheet?

If you mean a spreadsheet, would all the data you need to sort through be in on column?

Read full topic
